fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025e3.equipments.heater.sil

Class HeaterTemperatureSILModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
        • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.AtomicHIOA
          • fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025e3.equipments.heater.sil.HeaterTemperatureSILModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HeaterOperationI, SIL_HeaterOperationI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.interfaces.VariableDefinitionsAndSharingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.interfaces.VariableInitialisationI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.AtomicModelI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.EventsExchangingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.ModelI, java.io.Serializable

    @ModelExternalEvents(imported={SwitchOffHeater.class,SIL_SetPowerHeater.class,Heat.class,DoNotHeat.class})
 @ModelImportedVariable(name="externalTemperature",
                       type=java.lang.Double.class)
public class HeaterTemperatureSILModel
extends fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.AtomicHIOA
implements SIL_HeaterOperationI
    The class HeaterTemperatureSILModel defines a simulation model for the temperature inside a room equipped with a heater.

    Description

    The model is implemented as an atomic HIOA model. A differential equation defines the temperature variation over time. It uses a very simple mathematical model where the derivative is proportional to the difference between the current temperature and the temperature that influences the current one. In fact, there are two temperatures that influences the current temperature of the room:

    1. the temperature outside the house (room) where the coefficient applied to the difference between the outside temperature and the current temperature models the thermal insulation of the walls (INSULATION_TRANSFER_CONSTANT);
    2. the temperature of the heater when it heats where the coefficient applied to the difference between the heater temperature (STANDARD_HEATING_TEMP) and the current temperature models the heat diffusion over the house (room) (HEATING_TRANSFER_CONSTANT); the heat diffusion is not constant but rather proportional to the current power level of the heater.

    The resulting differential equation is integrated using the Euler method with a predefined integration step. The initial state of the model is a state not heating and the initial temperature given by INITIAL_TEMPERATURE.

    Whether the current temperature evolves under the influence of the outside temperature only or also the heating temperature depends upon the state, which in turn is modified through the reception of imported events Heat and DoNotHeat. The external temperature is imported from another model simulating the environment. The current temperature is exported to be used by other models.

    • Imported events: SwitchOffHeater, Heat, DoNotHeat
    • Exported events: none
    • Imported variables: none
    • Exported variables: name = externalTemperature, type = Double

    Implementation Invariants

     invariant       TEMPERATURE_UPDATE_TOLERANCE >= 0.0
 invariant       POWER_HEAT_TRANSFER_TOLERANCE >= 0.0
 invariant       INSULATION_TRANSFER_CONSTANT > 0.0
 invariant       MIN_HEATING_TRANSFER_CONSTANT > 0.0
 invariant       STEP > 0.0
 invariant       currentState != null
 invariant       integrationStep.getSimulatedDuration() > 0.0
 invariant       !isStateInitialised() || start != null
 invariant       currentHeatingPower >= 0.0
 invariant       currentTemperature != null

    Invariants

     invariant       URI != null && !URI.isEmpty()

    Created on : 2023-09-29

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

        update tolerance for the temperature i.e., shortest elapsed time since the last update under which the temperature is not changed by the update to avoid too large computation errors.
